IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On 02/24/2023, I TFC Doyle #6144 was done routine patrol in the area of eastbound Dual highway at Edgewood Drive. I observed the vehicle inform of me accurate at a high rate of speed in lane one. I caught up to the vehicle and began to pace the vehicle. My marked patrol vehicle O-33 speedometer is calibrated as required by the Maryland State Police Policy. The vehicle was traveling 60 miles per hour in a 45 miles per hour zone. The vehicle was identified as a gray Nissan Altima bearing Maryland registration 4EN0191. The Nissan swerved over the fog line on the left shoulder by a tire width. The vehicle slowed back down to 40 miles per hour then accelerated again to 60 miles per hour and swerved over the center doted line into lane two by a tire width. I initiated my emergency equipment and the vehicle merged from lane one to two and stopped eastbound Dual Highway at All Star Court. I made contact with the driver via the driver side window, who was identified as Casey Ann Schuller DOB: 01/02/1981 by her Maryland identification card. Casey was advised the reason for the stop. Casey was smoking a cigarette and avoided making eye contact with me. While searching for her license and registration i detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from the vehicle. I asked Casey if she had any alcoholic beverages tonight to which she stated she had a few shots. Casey still has not made eye contact with me. I returned to my patrol vehicle and conducted a routine NCIC/METERs check of the vehicle and Casey. Casey returned on a ID only and had no license. I returned to vehicle via the driver side again and requested Casey exit the vehicle and walk to the front of her vehicle, to which she did. I again asked Casey how much she had to drink. Casey stated she had two shots of vodka before she left the house to go pick up her daughter. While speaking to Casey outside the vehicle I detected to strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from her person. I observed Casey to have bloodshot and glassy eyes. Casey was slurring her speech. I requested Casey to perform Standardized Field Soberity Tests to which she stated yes. (Pre Arrest Screening) The following questions were asked Glasses or contact lenses and Casey Stated, No, but I had eye surgery. Any Injures, Casey stated, No. Take any medication. Casey advised se took allergy medication in the mornings. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus: 6/6 Clues Observed. The first test given was the horizontal gaze nystagmus test. The tip of my pen was used as the tests stimulus. It was held approximately 12-15 inches from Caseys eyes, slightly above her eye level. Casey was instructed to look straight ahead, keeping her head still, and follow the tip of the stimulus with her eyes. Casey was positioned in a manner to ensure the headlights of passing traffic would not interfere with the test results. I asked Casey if she understood the test, and she stated, Yes. Casey displayed Equal pupil size, equal tracking and no resting Nystagmus in either eye. Casey displayed a lack of smooth pursuit in both eyes Casey displayed a distinct and sustained Nystagmus at maximum deviation in both eyes. Casey displayed an onset of Nystagmus prior to 45 degrees in both eyes. Walk and Turn test: 7/8 clues observed The test was explained and demonstrated. Casey was instructed to place her right for directly in front of her left foot and touch heel to toe. Casey was then instructed to place her hands flat at her sides and remain in the position until told to begin. Casey was advised to take nine (9) steps in a straight line touching heel to toe on ever step. On the ninth step, she was instructed to keep her lead foot on the line, and to take a series of small steps to the left with her rear foot to turn completely around. After the turn, Casey was instructed to complete the second series on nine (9) steps in the same heel to toe fashion. Casey was instructed to keep her hands flat at her sides, keeping her eyes focused on her foot, count every step aloud, and once she began the test she was not to stop walking until the test was completed. I asked Casey if she understood the test, and she stated yes. Instruction phase: Lost Balance on 3 occasions. Casey started too soon on 5 occasions Walking Stage first nine: Casey missed heel to toe on steps 1,3,5,6,7 and 9 Casey stepped off-line on steps 2 and 8 Casey raised her arms more than 12 inches from her side Casey stopped walking on stop 9 after making her improper turn. Walking Stage second nine: Casey missed heel to toe on steps 1,2,4,5, and 6 Casey stepped off-line on steps 3,7 and 9 Casey raised her arms above 12 inches from her side. Case made a left turn in large steps removing her lead foot and failing to complete the turn as instructed. One leg stand: 3/4 clues observed. The test was explained and demonstrated. Casey was instructed to stand with her heels together and hands down by her sides while the instruction were given. When instructed to state, she was to raise the foot of her choice off the ground approximately 6 inches. While her leg was raised, she was to keep her leg straight, watch the raised for, and to court out loud by thousands (one thousand one, two thousand two, ect...) and to not put her foot down until the end of the test. I asked Casey if she understood the test, and she stated yes. 0-30 seconds: Casey put her foot down 5 times Casey was swaying back and forth left to right. Casey raised her arms more than 12 inches from her side. Casey was offered a PBT to which she agreed to take. PBT results .097 Arrest: Casey was placed under arrest at 0058 hours for driving under the influence. Casey was transported to the Maryland State Police Hagerstown Barrack where she was advised her Advice of Rights via DR15 and refused to take an intoximeter tests at and signing the DR15 at 0120 hours. Casey was giving all prudent paperwork and released from the Hagerstown Barrack to a sober adult. All events occurred in Washington County, Maryland Case closed.
